com.google.flightmap.android.location
Class LocationSimulator

java.lang.Object
  com.google.flightmap.android.location.LocationSimulator

 class LocationSimulator
extends Object

Provides a simulated Location. This class does not extend LocationProvider nor does it get added as a test provider through LocationManager.addTestProvider(java.lang.String, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, int, int). That is deliberate.

For this application we want users to be able to use the simulator mode to learn how it works on the ground while stationary, rather than only being able to learn it while moving. Portable aviation GPS units have built in simulator modes for the same reason.

Method Detail

start

void start(LocationHandler locationHandler)
Starts the simulator. Position updates will be sent to the locationHandler by calling LocationHandler.onLocationChanged(android.location.Location)

public void update()
Updates position every UPDATE_RATE milliseconds using LocationSimulator.PositionUpdater.

getDefaultLocation

public static android.location.Location getDefaultLocation()
Returns a default location to use if there's no real location to start from. (The Googleplex in Mountain View, CA.)

updateValue

private float updateValue(float currentValue,
                          float desiredValue,
                          float changeRate)
Returns the new value that should be set for a rate-based value.

Parameters:
currentValue - current value.
desiredValue - desired value.
changeRate - rate of change per second.

updateBearingValue

private float updateBearingValue(float bearing,
                                 float desiredBearing,
                                 int turnRate)
Returns the new value for a bearing. Handles special cases like the desired bearing being 10 when the current bearing is 350.

Parameters:
bearing - current bearing
desiredBearing - desired bearing
turnRate - rate of turn in degrees per second.
